priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Nervous System Physiology Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C116104

self.title: CDISC SDTM Nervous System Physiology Test Code Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test codes that describe nervous system physiology findings.
name: Nervous System Findings Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Nervous System Physiology Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of change in volume of an organ or anatomical feature as determined by a shift in tissue boundary over time.
An assessment of the latency of the N145 or N2 wave of the visual evoked potential assessment waveform.
An assessment of the latency of the N75 or N1 wave of the visual evoked potential assessment waveform.
The magnitude, or height, of the P100 wave of the visual evoked potential assessment waveform. This assessment calculates the height from the N75 negative peak to the P100 positive peak.
terms.preferredTerm: N75 to P100 Peak to Peak Amplitude

terms.definition: An assessment of the latency of the P100 or P1 wave of the visual evoked potential assessment waveform.
The ratio between the tissue radioactivity concentration at a point in time C(T) and the injected dose of radioactivity per kilogram of the patient's body weight.
The ratio between the uptake or binding of a radiopharmaceutical agent in an anatomical region of interest and a context-defined reference anatomical region.
The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length.
The amount of three dimensional space occupied by an object or the capacity of a space or container. (NCI)
